entries.title: Reflections on Building in Public
entries.content:
Today I've been thinking about the value of building in public. There's something powerful about sharing the journey, not just the destination. It creates accountability, attracts like-minded people, and helps others learn from both successes and mistakes.

In the Bitcoin space especially, transparency is a core value. Why should building be any different?

entries.title: On Time Preference
entries.content:
Been diving deeper into the concept of time preference and how Bitcoin naturally encourages low time preference thinking. When you understand that your money won't lose value over time, you start thinking longer-term.

This isn't just about investingâ€”it's about how we approach life, work, and relationships. Sound money creates sound thinking.

entries.title: Learning Node.js
entries.content:
Started working with Node.js for a new project. The asynchronous nature takes some getting used to if you're coming from other languages, but the ecosystem is incredibly rich.

Planning to build something that connects to Bitcoin Core's RPC. More details to come.

entries.title: Why I Write
entries.content:
Someone asked me why I spend time writing when I could be coding. The answer is simple: writing clarifies thinking.

When you can explain a complex concept clearly, it means you truly understand it. Plus, the best way to learn is to teach. Writing is teaching at scale.

entries.title: First Entry
entries.content:
Starting this journal to document thoughts, learnings, and the journey. Not everything needs to be a polished article. Sometimes the raw, unfiltered thoughts are the most valuable.

Here's to consistent writing and growth.
